channel.title: Comments on: React.js By Example: Interacting with the DOM

item.title: By: saad
item.dc:creator: saad
item.description: Aweeeeeeeeeeeesome Article... Thanks for sharing much much better than React Documentation
item.content:encoded: Aweeeeeeeeeeeesome Article… Thanks for sharing much much better than React Documentation

item.title: By: Anteka
item.dc:creator: Anteka
item.description: Thank so you much for your articles. I couldn't find anything in the official documentation that explained how refs worked in such a straightforward manner. Everything I saw failed to explain it in simple terms and always presented the concept in tandem with more complex examples. This, along with your tutorial on using React without JSX, have proven invaluable. Thank you again.
item.content:encoded: Thank so you much for your articles. I couldn’t find anything in the official documentation that explained how refs worked in such a straightforward manner. Everything I saw failed to explain it in simple terms and always presented the concept in tandem with more complex examples. This, along with your tutorial on using React without JSX, have proven invaluable. Thank you again.

item.title: By: tomwang
item.dc:creator: tomwang
item.description: i think maybe we could remove isMounted from Exercise 2; As i know, componentDidUpdate means the component's updates are flushed to the DOM, i.e. it is ALREADY mounted. Is it right?
item.content:encoded: i think maybe we could remove isMounted from Exercise 2; As i know, componentDidUpdate means the component’s updates are flushed to the DOM, i.e. it is ALREADY mounted. Is it right?
